article_title: Book Review: 'The Case Against the Supreme Court' by Erwin Chemerinsky
article_text:
In making the case for ratification of the American Constitution, Alexander Hamilton wrote that the judiciary "will always be the least dangerous branch to the political rights of the Constitution." Erwin Chemerinsky would tell Hamilton that the judiciary hasn't proved so benign: The blunt title of his new book is "The Case Against the Supreme Court."

The author, a law professor of liberal conviction at the University of California, Irvine, used to think that "despite obvious missteps the court...
